title: Gran Turismo 7 Update 1.61 available today
description: Only 19 of the ‘05 NISMO R34 GT-R Z-tune were produced by Nissan’s performance division. Nineteen. With some mathing, that’s one of Z-tune R34 for every 424,315,789 humans on Earth. If you happen to be one of the ridiculously few, good for you. For the rest of us, we have the free Update 1.61 from […]
author: Ken Chan

title: New PS5 system update beta previews DualSense wireless controller pairing across multiple devices
description: Many PS5 peripherals, including the DualSense wireless controller, are designed to support a variety of devices beyond PS5 including PC, Mac, and mobile devices. We believe enabling compatibility of our peripherals across multiple platforms creates a more flexible and seamless gaming experience. As part of this effort, we’re excited to announce that the latest PS5 […]
author: Shuzo Kikuchi

title: New Stranger Things Lego Figures Available Ahead Of Final Season
description: Lego Stranger Things BrickHeadz (542 pieces) $40 | Releases October 1 Preorder at Lego Store The fifth and final season of Stranger Things is almost here, and to celebrate, Lego has just unveiled new BrickHeadz collectibles of the show's main cast. The collection launches October 1 and will include four buildable figures of characters Mike Wheeler, Dustin Henderson, Lucas Sinclair, and Will Byers. Preorders are available now for $40 at Lego's online store. We expect these will be a popular collector's item, so grab them while you can. Lego Stranger Things BrickHeadz (542 pieces) $40 | Releases October 1 Like other BrickHeadz collectibles, the Lego Stranger Things BrickHeadz set is designed to adapt the look--and '80s fashion--of the characters they're based on in an adorable blocky form. Each figure stands securely on a display base, and there are a few accessories like a walkie-talkie for Mike, a headset for Dustin, and a slingshot and binoculars for Lucas. Preorders are available exclusively at Lego, and it's rare for Brickheadz sets to appear at other retailers. Preorder at Lego Store This is only the second Stranger Things set released by Lego so far. There was also The Upside Down Lego playset, but it's unfortunately been sold out for a while--so if you're looking to add some Stranger Things to your Lego collection, grab these Brickheadz while you can.Stranger Things: The Complete Scripts Volumes 1-4 PreordersStranger Things fans will also want to check out the upcoming Stranger Things: The Complete Scripts book series that collects the Duffer Brothers' screenplays for each of the show's first four seasons into individual volumes. The first two volumes in the four-book series launch September 2, while Volumes 3 and 4 will arrive on December 9. Preorders for all four paperback editions are available for $30 each at Amazon.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Lego Announces New Wicked: For Good Sets Launching September 1
description: Lego Wicked Emerald City Wall Art (1,518 pieces) $160 | Releases September 1 Preorder at Lego Store Lego Wicked Glinda & Elphaba Bookends (1,327 pieces) $130 | Releases September 1 Preorder at Lego Store Lego Wicked Emerald City & Kiamo Ko Castle (860 pieces) $80 | Releases September 1 Preorder at Lego Store Lego Wicked Glinda & Elphaba Visit Munchkinland (744 pieces) $70 | Releases September 1 Preorder at Lego Store Lego Wicked Elphaba's Retreat (228 pieces) $28 | Releases September 1 Preorder at Lego Store Lego Wicked Glinda's Wedding Day (476 pieces) $40 | Releases September 1 Preorder at Lego Store Lego BrickHeadz Wicked Elphaba & Glinda Figures (325 pieces) $20 | Releases September 1 Preorder at Lego Store Lego Wicked Welcome to Emerald City (945 pieces) $84 (was $100) See at Amazon Lego Wicked Elphaba's Dormitory (740 pieces) $56 (was $70) See at Amazon Lego Wicked Elphaba & Glinda Figures (558 pieces) $44 (was $55) See at Amazon Lego Wicked Glinda, Elphaba, and Nessarose at Shiz University (304 pieces) $24 (was $30) See at Amazon Wicked: For Good hits theaters on November 21, and folks eager for the magical journey to continue can look forward to a bunch of new Lego Wicked sets on September 1. Lego just announced seven new sets based on the new film, ranging from playsets based on memorable scenes and locations like Elphaba's Retreat and Glinda's Wedding Day, to ornate displays like the Emerald City Wall Art set.The six new Lego Wicked sets are all available to preorder now. You can check them all out in the list below, along with links to preorder. The new products are bound to be popular, so consider preordering them if you're interested. We've also included the four previously released Lego sets based on the first Wicked movie, in case you want to fill out your collection. And if you're looking for even more new and upcoming Lego sets, be sure to check out our roundup of all the new Star Wars Lego sets dropping August 1, as well as the newly announced sets based on Stranger Things, Batman, and the Nintendo Game Boy that are available to preorder. Lego Wicked Emerald City Wall Art (1,518 pieces) $160 | Releases September 1 This massive 1,518-piece set lets you build a wall art display of the Emerald City as it appears in Wicked: For Good. The detailed set features several 3D elements, including two display sections to place the included Glinda and Elphaba minifigures. The set also includes additional minifigures of Dorothy, Toto, Scarecrow, Tin Man, and the Cowardly Lion. Preorder at Lego Store Lego Wicked Glinda & Elphaba Bookends (1,327 pieces) $130 | Releases September 1 Whether you use them to organize books or Blu-rays, these two cool builds should make a colorful addition to any room. One is pink while the other is green, both featuring accessories like the Grimmerie, a Shiz University model, butterflies, and a green elixir bottle. You'll get several minifigures, too--Glinda, Elphaba, Madame Morrible, Fiyero, and Pfannee. The build features several hidden compartments, allowing you to store tiny accessories or a handful of minifigures. Preorder at Lego Store Lego Wicked Emerald City & Kiamo Ko Castle (860 pieces) $80 | Releases September 1 The Lego Emerald City & Kiamo Ko Castle play set lets you build miniaturized versions of Glinda's room in the Emerald City and Elphaba's personal chambers in Kiamo Ko Castle. The two buildings fold out to reveal multiple hidden compartments. The set also includes minifigures of Elphaba, Glinda, and a Flying Monkey, plus a handful of accessories. Preorder at Lego Store Lego Wicked Glinda & Elphaba Visit Munchkinland (744 pieces) $70 | Releases September 1 Piece together your own blocky version of Munchkinland. The large set clocks in just under 750 pieces, making it one of the bigger playsets arriving on September 1. The blocky version of Munchkinland features an interactive mechanism that surrounds the included Glinda minifigure in a transparent bubble--just like in the movie. The building also includes interior details, such as a kitchen and bedroom. Preorder at Lego Store Lego Wicked Elphaba's Retreat (228 pieces) $28 | Releases September 1 The 228-piece Elphaba's Retreat playset recreates a forest scene from the movies and includes minifigures for Elphaba and Fiyero, as well as accessories such as the Grimmerie, wild rabbits, carrots, and numerous books and potions. It's also one of the more affordable products arriving on September 1. Preorder at Lego Store Lego Wicked Glinda's Wedding Day (476 pieces) $40 | Releases September 1 This playset features some of the coolest visual elements from the Wicked: For Good wedding scene, including giant interactive butterflies that swivel to reveal the wedding scene, complete with an arched doorway, stone steps, animal figures, and two minifigures, including Glinda in her ornate wedding gown. Preorder at Lego Store Lego BrickHeadz Wicked Elphaba & Glinda Figures (325 pieces) $20 | Releases September 1 These adorable, ultra-blocky Brickheadz figures of Elphaba and Glinda come with their own accessories, including a tiara for Glinda and a hat and broomstick for Elphaba. You can even mix and match pieces if you want to build your own unique mash-up character. Preorder at Lego Store Lego Wicked Welcome to Emerald City (945 pieces) $84 (was $100) Unlike the above sets, this one (and the three below) originally launched alongside the first movie and are already available. The Welcome to Emerald City Set is a large playset that includes five minidolls--Glinda, Elphaba, The Wizard, Madame Morrible, and Fiyero. The big draw, however, is the buildable tower, offering a variety of rooms to explore and accessories to interact with. See at Amazon Lego Wicked Elphaba's Dormitory (740 pieces) $56 (was $70) Build a small replica of the girls' University dorm, complete with beds, dressers, mirrors, and other knick-knacks. Two minidolls for Elphaba and Glinda are also included. The whole playset folds closed for easy storage, morphing into Glinda's lockable trunk (which makes for a cool piece of décor). See at Amazon Lego Wicked Elphaba & Glinda Figures (558 pieces) $44 (was $55) Not to be confused with the BrickHeadz Figures, these are more like traditional dolls. The two figures are highly posable and equipped with tons of accessories (such as brooms, crowns, and purses), giving you plenty of ways to change up their looks. See at Amazon Lego Wicked Glinda, Elphaba, and Nessarose at Shiz University (304 pieces) $24 (was $30) This set lets you build a small dollhouse and sailboat and includes minidolls for Glinda, Elphaba, and Nessarose. You'll also get accessories like a wheelchair, book stand, and spellbook. The boat is also slightly interactive, with a sail that can be moved to simulate wind. See at Amazon More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Amazon Restocks The $40 Licensed Alternative To Switch 2 All-In-One Case Nintendo Switch 2 At Amazon - Console Restocks, Every Accessory You Can Buy, And More God Of War 20th Anniversary Retrospective Box Set Gets Nice Discount + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5) Lord Of The Rings Tolkien Illustrated Book Is Only $30 At Amazon Right Now Berserk's Best Anime Adaptation Gets Limited-Time Price Cut At Amazon Happy Gilmore And Billy Madison 4K Blu-Ray Preorders Steeply Discounted At Amazon 8BitDo's New $50 iPhone Controller Is Officially Licensed By Xbox Superman 4K Blu-Ray Steelbook Edition Is Up For Preorder At Amazon More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Amazon Restocks The $40 Licensed Alternative To Switch 2 All-In-One Case Nintendo Switch 2 At Amazon - Console Restocks, Every Accessory You Can Buy, And More God Of War 20th Anniversary Retrospective Box Set Gets Nice Discount + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5) Lord Of The Rings Tolkien Illustrated Book Is Only $30 At Amazon Right Now Berserk's Best Anime Adaptation Gets Limited-Time Price Cut At Amazon Happy Gilmore And Billy Madison 4K Blu-Ray Preorders Steeply Discounted At Amazon 8BitDo's New $50 iPhone Controller Is Officially Licensed By Xbox Superman 4K Blu-Ray Steelbook Edition Is Up For Preorder At Amazon

title: Double Fine Honor's Heavy Metal Legend Ozzy Osbourne by Making Heavy Metal Video Game Brütal Legend Free for 666 Minutes Only

The duo finally make their appearance on the eleventh layer where you can find them racing alongside Rambi and a bunch of other rhinos. The bananas on this layer are mostly on the starting […]

Inside this heap of garbage, you’ll need to search behind metal scrap, dirt, and loads of debris to to collect all of the golden bananas. Below, we […]

author: Lloyd Coombes

title: Grim and joyful deckbuilder The Royal Writ is coming for genre king Balatro next month
description: The Fool King is dead, long live the Deckbuilder King. The Decking, if you will. Publishers Yogscast Games have announced that festive card-based roguelite The Royal Writ will launch on 7th August. The Royal Writ seems pretty spesh, and yet, we have never covered it before, because we are blundering philistines. Sorry about that. In our defence, this is yet another cousin of Balatro on some level, and there's only so many of those I can process in one year before my thumbs and eyes swell up in protest. But based on a quick snort of the Steam demo, The Royal Writ stands apart thanks to 1) immensely jovial animated storybook visuals 2) an interesting set of card sacrifice mechanics. Here is a trailer. Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 886
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. What time of the day are you at your best? From 5:30 until about 11 in the morning. Everything is downhill after lunch, which is when I turn into Sleepy Spice, hahaha! I don’t know when it happened, but somewhere along the way in the last 10 years, I became a morning person. 2. Things you like in your smoothie? Greek yogurt, vanilla protein powder, raspberries (for fiber!) are my favorites. I also like bananas or apples for sweetness. 3. Something about your current makeup routine that bugs you? Ugh, the concealer I’ve been using from MAC just doesn’t seal well after I use it. Bits and bobs of it end up all over the place. It’s super messy and it bothers me. 4. Something about your[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 886 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 866
description: Rosie should have known better than to trust Marnie with Rosie’s investments. After all, Marnie doesn’t have any background or credentials or expertise in financial planning. There was no reason to think Marnie would be able to manage Rosie’s assets, but Rosie wanted to give her a chance. Oh, well. Bad move on Rosie’s part. Even someone of Rosie’s intellectual stature screws up sometimes. Sure, she may understand quantum physics better than any other cat on the planet, but that doesn’t mean she understands compound interest. Sigh… Now Rosie has to think of a way of to recoup all those losses. Hmm… What could she invent? I’m sure she’ll think of something. 🐱 Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 866 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen
